replies.msg:
Ronaldo revealed in an interview with France Football that he felt Perez only ever valued him for his profitability, saying: "He only ever looked at me as a business relationship. I know it. What he told me never came from the heart."

â€‹Real Madrid claimed that Ronaldo's €99m transfer to â€‹Juventus in July was instigated 'at the will and the request of the player', but Ronaldo says Perez's attitude played a part too.

"I felt it inside the club, especially from the president, that they no longer considered me the same way that they did in the start," he said. "In the first four or five years there, I had the feeling of being ‘Cristiano Ronaldo’. Less afterwards.

"The president looked at me through eyes that didn’t want to say the same thing, as if I was no longer indispensable to them, if you know what I mean. That’s what made me think about leaving.

"If it had all been about money, I’d have moved to China, where I would have earned five times as much than here [at Juventus] or at Real. I did not come to Juve for the money. I earned the same in Madrid, if not more. The difference is that, at Juve, they really wanted me. They told me that and made it clear. They showed me that."

Jorge Valdano: “We continue to measure Bale based on his price. His price tag has created a fantasy that he is a world superstar. But the last five years don't correspond to what Real Madrid paid for him, even if every season he is applauded for scoring the goal of the year."



Jorge Valdano: “After seven minutes Bale left Jordi Alba alone," he added. At first they [star players] respect the tactics, but then their nature is shown. They think they have the authority to do what they want even if it goes against the collective."

Bale’s agent, Jonathan Barnett, has responded: “It comes from nothing, so it is taken as nothing.”

No Real Madrid bid for Palacios, says River Plate midfielder's agent

Real Madrid have not agreed a deal with River Plate to sign Exequiel Palacios but Inter Milan are interested, according to the player’s agent.

Corsi told Argentine radio station El Mundo: “Nobody called me from Real Madrid because of Palacios – [Inter vice-president Javier] Zanetti called to let me know that they are following him because he is a player that interests them, but only that.”

He added: “With Inter we spoke, we did not commit to anything. They love the player, Zanetti told me they are following him.”

Juventus 'interested in reuniting James Rodriguez with Cristiano Ronaldo' if Bayern Munich are willing to cut short Real Madrid star's loan

Juventus 'are plotting to reunite James Rodriguez with his former Real Madrid team-mate Cristiano Ronaldo'.

The Colombian playmaker, 27, has been on loan at German champions Bayern Munich from Real since the summer of 2017 but could be on the move as soon as January if Juventus have their way.

'NO CONTACT' FOR MARTINEZ

The Belgium FA say there has been no contact from Real Madrid to Belgium manager Roberto Martinez.

The former Everton and Wigan boss has been linked with the vacant job at the Bernabeu.

But, in a statement, the Belgium FA have said: "So far Real Madrid have not been in contact with the Belgian FA.

"If they should be interested they should contact the Belgium FA and ask permission to start negotiations. That has not been the case so far."

Nacho: Real Madrid will work as if Solari is here all season

Santiago Solari may only be the interim coach at Real Madrid, but Nacho Fernandez said: "We will work as if he is here for the full season."

Nacho: 'We'll see what happens'

After Madrid's comprehensive success against third-tier Melilla, Nacho told beIN SPORTS: "We will work as if he [Solari] is here for the full season. He is from here; he is experienced; he has won titles with Madrid.

"We, the players, don't have to make these decisions and we will see what happens but he's a great coach.

"The squad was with Lopetegui, but we didn't have any luck. Now we have a new coach, who is excited, and we will fight to the death for him, too."

Nacho acknowledged the days following Madrid's 5-1 loss to Barca had not been easy.

"It has been a difficult time after the Clásico, where he had a result which we hadn't expected," the Spain defender added.

"But this is football and, luckily, we had a game very soon after, which we wanted to win and above all score goals in. Obviously, it's painful to lose like the other day but thankfully there are more games to come."

Manchester City youngster Brahim Diaz ready to join Real Madrid on free transfer next summer


Manchester City are at serious risk of losing another of their best young talents, with Brahim Diaz likely to follow in the footsteps of Jadon Sancho by quitting the Premier League champions over a lack of playing time.

Real Madrid are increasingly confident of signing Diaz on a free transfer next summer when the Spain Under-21 attacking midfielder’s contract with City expires.

Manchester City youngster Brahim Diaz ready to join Real Madrid on free transfer next summer


Manchester City are at serious risk of losing another of their best young talents, with Brahim Diaz likely to follow in the footsteps of Jadon Sancho by quitting the Premier League champions over a lack of playing time.

Real Madrid are increasingly confident of signing Diaz on a free transfer next summer when the Spain Under-21 attacking midfielder’s contract with City expires.
